97f98e5df342.description: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC, the largest and most active early-stage fund in Southern California. Snapchat: msuster
97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table
97f98e5df342.shortDescription: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC…

paragraphs.name: 8b45
paragraphs.text: I’ve written before about visualization and creativity and how important this has been to my career.

Another predictable sign of hubris in startups is when the founders start looking for other companies to buy. If you’re an early-stage startup and even contemplating acquiring other companies slap yourself in the face and focus on your own business instead. M&A junkies are hatched from businesses where the core isn’t working and it seems far easier to acquire another startup than to do the hard work of refining your own.

paragraphs.name: ee7d
paragraphs.text: Mojo.

37764231c160.title: I believe disrupting the system is the epitome of entrepreneurial creativity and leadership.

paragraphs.text: I believe disrupting the system is the epitome of entrepreneurial creativity and leadership. This is precisely why my company created our app. It’s super disruptive to empower people and enrich their lives. I have had many people lament the impossibility creating such an app only to find we have just launched. The leader must stay focused and strong…
paragraphs.name: e392

paragraphs.text: Such a delightful read. So true and you covered basically all possible states of mind of an entrepreneur. And it came at the right time as it gives me a good food for thought for my business. Thanks again the post.
paragraphs.name: 5d40

paragraphs.text: Dead on. Nice.
paragraphs.name: cb52

paragraphs.text: More important: mojo or grit? I’d argue that grit is the underlying character trait that enables a founder to reclaim their mojo. Without grit, mojo is bound to be impermanent and fleeting.
paragraphs.name: 20aa

aebd3ade1ce5.title: I seriously think that one of the early VR surprises will be getting people to relax and get into a…

paragraphs.text: I seriously think that one of the early VR surprises will be getting people to relax and get into a creative or meditative zone.
paragraphs.name: 2ba9

paragraphs.text: Amazing post. Makes me think of Clayton Christensen’s Theory of Disruption…post series A a company has likely started to find that emerging market and early adopters; however, there is a chasm to cross before the new technology in the emerging market becomes viable in the larger mass market. To me, it seems gutting it through this chasm is what determines the long term winners vs those that throw in the towel.

8a7859b07c34.title: Right on Mark, and this is just as applicable at the preseed/seed/angel stages.

paragraphs.text: Right on Mark, and this is just as applicable at the preseed/seed/angel stages. There were months at a time when we were so stuck I felt paralyzed, and this was after failing over and over again to raise money despite my best efforts.
paragraphs.name: e990

paragraphs.text: I was mad but also reflective, then pulled my shit together and accepted that having a few…

virtuals.subtitle: I was mad but also reflective, then pulled my shit together and accepted that having a few customers, a well-received vision is NOT real…

content.subtitle: I was mad but also reflective, then pulled my shit together and accepted that having a few customers, a well-received vision is NOT real…

ae7531ef1200.title: Overall a great post, but I agree with joe may that a startup looking to do M&A is not always a…

paragraphs.text: Overall a great post, but I agree with joe may that a startup looking to do M&A is not always a sign of laziness or weakness in building out something great themselves. Done properly, it can bring an immediate gain to the business through a useful technology or team that significantly moves the needle for the acquiring startup.

virtuals.subtitle: In fact, if anything, an M&A deal done for mostly equity could even be looked at as a sign of strength by the acquiring startup, given…

content.subtitle: In fact, if anything, an M&A deal done for mostly equity could even be looked at as a sign of strength by the acquiring startup, given…

6ece6651fbc8.title: Yep! The nail has hit the head once more, Mark. How do you do that?

paragraphs.text: Yep! The nail has hit the head once more, Mark. How do you do that?
paragraphs.name: 4b66

paragraphs.text: Great post Mark! Thanks again for your continued candor. I try every day to work with a little chip on my shoulder. When it starts to feel too heavy, I’ll search YouTube for a great Tony Robbins, Zig Ziglar, Les Brown, Eric Thomas or other motivational talk and get right back in the game.
paragraphs.name: 22e3

ea4c0fdf2cf9.title: I agree and stand behind your thoughts and knowledge, because in my life of expectations and dreams…

paragraphs.text: I agree and stand behind your thoughts and knowledge, because in my life of expectations and dreams there has been confidence , let downs and people who speak negative to us. But in truth it is us who decide and choose the path we take. I have learned that in order to take on something you must believe you can do it and believe in what your doing…
paragraphs.name: 14cb

16b2834ffb00.title: Mark, this is one of your best pieces — and that’s saying a lot!

paragraphs.text: Mark, this is one of your best pieces — and that’s saying a lot! I’ve looked at the whole journey of starting my company in retrospect. Pre-funding, series A, B, C. I think I was not even fully aware of what I was doing before series A. Then A happened, and it was incredibly validating. The speaking, the traveling, the TV/Radio/Podcast shows. By…

ceb850b28b59.title: I have to wonder if this is necessarily true in all business.

paragraphs.text: I have to wonder if this is necessarily true in all business. Sure, it’s foolish for a small software company to buy another small software company for its users or an easy-to-build feature, but in some cases, buying a company may be the best way to get very specific talent or technology that would be costly and time-consuming to develop in-house.
